intro: Randia colimensis, commonly known as the pink randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, pink to white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Randia colimensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
